channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned and Damaged Vehicle on Thicket Road, near postbox (black Peugeot), 11th October
item.description:
I am reporting a vehicle (a black Peugeot 207) that appears to be abandoned. It has a completely flat front tyre and a detached bumper, suggesting crash damage. The car has not moved for a significant period and is occupying a vital parking space in a high-demand residential area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: Electric Van blocking drive, 11th October
item.description:
I have seen this van many times, it's sad to see that the resident can't leave her parking gates because of a Imbercile parking over the dropped curb. It has tickets already, please remove.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delaford Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Severe fungal infection, 11th October
item.description:
I'm worried that this tree is dying due to a fungal infection and could easily become a hazard, especially if it falls. Could a tree specialist check it out please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodbastwick Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement, 11th October
item.description:
My Grandad fell over after a game at Millwall, it was dark and the pavement is uneven in places, he has hurt his elbow and face as he fell down. Just needs some attention! Thank you x
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delaford Road, Bermondsey, London
